attributes.action: Opposing President Rajapaska's human rights record and regime against press freedom
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The scheduled London Summit on 9-10 June is a great endeavor and we hope sincerely that the discussions will prove to be valuable.
Unfortunately the president of Sri Lanka is due to attend this summit and his invitation to such a gathering seems rather inappropriate given the current situation in Sri Lanka. 
Last month the UN human rights council rejected Sri Lanka’s bid for a seat. Council members are required to “uphold the highest standards” of human rights and “fully cooperate” with the council. A coalition of more than 20 nongovernmental organizations from all regions of the world wrote to UN members to oppose Sri Lanka’s re-election to the council, citing its government for a wide range of serious abuses, including hundreds of extrajudicial killings and enforced disappearances, widespread torture, and arbitrary detention.-HRW

Mon,9 June: Vigil 1-2pm at Marlborough House, Commonwealth Secretariat for Sri Lankan journalists killed and under threat - supported by AI(UK). 
Tues,10 June: 12–3pm also at Marlborough House
